name: Famous Acting Pairs Quiz / Test | Something in Common | 10 Questions

questions.text: Robert Redford and Paul Newman were one of the most beloved screen teams of the late 60s and early 70s, but they actually only appeared in two films together.  One was 'Butch Cassidy and the Sundance Kid', but what was the other?
questions.explanation:
The Sting.

	In 'The Sting', Robert Redford plays a small-time grifter named Johnny Hooker who hooks up with Newman's Henry Gondorff in a big time con job.

questions.text: Speaking of Mr. Newman, what is the name of his wife, with whom he starred in no fewer than 10 films?
questions.explanation:
Joanne Woodward.

	In order of their release, the 10 films featuring Newman and Woodward are: 'Rally Round the Flag, Boys!' (1958), 'The Long, Hot Summer' (1958), 'From the Terrace' (1960), 'Paris Blues' (1961), 'A New Kind of Love' (1963), 'Winning' (1969), 'WUSA' (1970), 'The Drowning Pool' (1975), 'Harry and Son' (1985) and'Mr. & Mrs. Bridge' (1990).

questions.text: Wesley Snipes and Woody Harrelson are an entertaining pair that have worked together on several movie projects.  Which among these films is not one in which they appeared together?
questions.explanation:
The People vs. Larry Flint

	'The People vs. Larry Flint' is a film featuring Woody Harrelson that details the difficult court battles that 'Hustler Magazine' publisher Larry Flint was forced to go through. Snipes and Harrelson first appeared together in the 1986 film 'Wildcats'.  They did not show up together in a film for another six years, when they made 'White Men Can't Jump in 92.  Three years later came the movie 'Money Train' (1995).  In 1999, Snipes appeared in cameo in Woody Harrelson's film 'Play It to the Bone' (Snipes played himself).

questions.text: Nobody has appeared in more films with Mel Gibson than Danny Glover.  What is the name of the series of buddy cop films that Gibson and Glover made together?
questions.explanation:
Lethal Weapon.

	From 1987 to 1998, Glover and Gibson appeared together as police partners Roger Murtaugh and Martin Riggs in four different 'Lethal Weapon' films.  Glover also made a cameo appearance in the Mel Gibson film 'Maverick' in 1994. In the 'Lethal Weapon' films, police partners Glover and Gibson fight various criminals and other vicious bad guys, such as smugglers and counterfeiters.

questions.text: Kirk Douglas and Burt Lancaster were a classic Hollywood screen team that made a total of five films together.  What was the name of the last film (from 1986) that paired these two film legends?
questions.explanation:
Tough Guys.

	'Tough Guys', a film about two old gangsters who have recently been released from prison and plan one last heist, was the last of the movies that paired Douglas and Lancaster.  The others: 'Gunfight at the O.K. Corral' (1957), 'The Devil's Disciple' (1959), 'The List of Adrian Messenger' (1963) and 'Seven Days in May (1964).

questions.text: Which actor/actress pair made several appearances in films together in the late 1970s, including a memorable one in the 1977 movie 'Smokey and the Bandit'?
questions.explanation:
Reynolds and Field.

	Burt Reynolds and Sally Field were quite the screen item in the late 1970s, appearing in the films 'Smokey and the Bandit' in 1977 and 'Hooper' and 'The End' in 1978.  They also paired up for a sequel to 'Smokey' in 1980.

questions.text: Which talented young actor was paired up with Judy Garland in no fewer than 10 films in the 1930s and 1940s?
questions.explanation:
Mickey Rooney.

	Judy Garland and Mickey Rooney shared the following screen credits: 'Thoroughbreds Don't Cry' (1937), 'Love Finds Andy Hardy' (1938), 'Babes in Arms' (1939), 'Strike Up the Band' (1940), 'Babes on Broadway' (1941), 'Life Begins for Andy Hardy' (1941), 'Girl Crazy' (1943), 'Thousands Cheer' (1943), 'Words and Music' (1948) and, finally, 'Andy Hardy Comes Home' (1958).

questions.text: One of my favorite screen teams matched funny men Gene Wilder and Richard Pryor.  Which of these was not a film in which this excellently funny pair appeared?
options: See No Evil, Hear No Evil
questions.explanation:
Blazing Saddles.

	Together, Wilder and Pryor appeared in 'Silver Streak' in 1976, 'Stir Crazy' in 1980, 'See No Evil, Hear No Evil' in 1989 and 'Another You' in 1991.  Pryor was set to appear in the 1974 film 'Blazing Saddles' with Wilder, but his presence in the film was rejected by the studio.  He was credited as a writer on the film. 'Blazing Saddles' was the story of a black sheriff in a racist town of the old west.  Gene Wilder plays the sheriff's sidekick, and together they foil the plot of a railroad magnate to destroy the town.

questions.text: In the late 1990s, which popular comedic actor made his first of several appearances with Owen Wilson in the film 'The Cable Guy'?
questions.explanation:
Ben Stiller.

	Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson have appeared in a number of movies together, including 'Permanent Midnight' (1998), 'Meet the Parents' (2000), 'The Royal Tenenbaums'(2001), 'Zoolander' (2001), 'Meet the Fockers' (2004) and 'Starsky & Hutch' (2004).  Let's hope their productive and amusing on-screen relationship continues for many years to come.

questions.text: Uma Thurman appeared in three films ('Gattaca', 'Tape' and 'Chelsea Walls') with which actor, who formerly happened to be her husband?
questions.explanation:
Ethan Hawke.

	Thurman and Hawke's ill-fated marriage began with Hawke after they made the 1997 film 'Gattaca' together.  In 2001 they participated in two more films together, 'Tape' and 'Chelsea Walls' (though, in the latter, Hawke only appeared in voice). Thank you for playing this quiz, I hope you have enjoyed it.
